title: Acorns Customer Support
description:
Customer Support Representative - Overnight | Acorns

At Acorns, we're building a different kind of investing experience - one that looks after the financial best interests of the up-and-coming. The Acorns team is passionate about pursuing our mission and living our values. It all begins with Heart. Our Heart leads us in everything we do. It allows us to make bold decisions, build trust, grow and advance our society. Come find your place at Acorns and join us in the movement to transform an industry.

Acorns is seeking Customer Support to build and maintain customers' trust in Acorns as a revolutionary investing service.

Through your product know-how and brilliant customer service, you'll help our users navigate through timely technical resolutions, product features, and best practices.

You must be able to work overnight from 9:00PM PT - 5:00AM PT.

Within 1 month, you will:

Learn about the fundamentals of Acorns mission and vision
Go through two-week training course that covers the policies, procedures and internal tools
Learn how to provide exceptional customer service as the point of user contact for all inquiries, concerns, and product requests via phone and email
Customer feedback is important, you'll Identify and escalate customer and product issues appropriately
Gain a deep understanding of product knowledge and how it directly impacts our customers
Meet with your Team Lead to go over performance and quality metrics

Within 6 months, you will:

Have dedicated 1x1's with your Team Lead to focus on your strengths and areas of opportunities
Go through chat training and focus on chat etiquette
Improving efficiency by understanding all workflows, policies and procedures
Participate in weekly team meetings to gain insight on company updates and provide feedback on ways to improve the customer experience
Master your soft skills and empathy to build rapport with every customer who contacts support
Enroll in training to receive your licenses for Series 7 & 66

Within 12 months, you will:

Weekly training to take licenses for Series 7 & 66
Have met or exceeded performance goals set by your Team Lead
Understand the company org chart and how each role functions

What you will bring to Acorns:

BA/BS degree required
0-2 years of account management/customer service experience
A passion for Acorns and a desire to share that enthusiasm and knowledge with customers
Strong relationship building skills with a commitment to service and delivery
Ability to work independently and effectively
Masterful problem-solving skills identifying customer need and providing thoughtful solutions
Exceptional customer-focused instincts with the ability to prioritize and escalate issues
High degree of professionalism and poise
Meticulous to a fault with a proven ability to multi- task
Excellent written and oral communications skills
Must be available to work 40 hours per week, with flexible hours including nights and weekends
You must be able to work overnight from 9:00PM PT - 5:00AM PT.
Spanish proficiency a plus

What we offer:

Competitive salary and stock options
A comprehensive benefits package to meet the needs of you and your family
Unlimited paid time off
Corporate gym access
Daily breakfast, weekly team lunches, and an endless supply of snacks
Numerous career possibilities that allow you to grow with Acorns
Talented and motivated team members who care deeply about one another, our mission and our customers.
The rare opportunity to create a new world. We inspire one another every day to do meaningful work that solves big societal challenges.

About Acorns:
Acorns is the leading micro-investing app in the U.S. It allows users to round up their daily purchases and automatically Invest the Change into a low-cost, diversified portfolio of exchange-traded funds offered by some of the world's top asset managers (including Vanguard and BlackRock). Founded in Newport Beach, Calif., by father and son team Walter and Jeff Cruttenden, Acorns provides a simple entry-point using the Acorns app on iPhone or Android. Customers accumulate fractional shares in one of five portfolios constructed by world-renowned Nobel Laureate economist Dr. Harry Markowitz. Acorns' smart portfolio algorithms automatically work in the background of life, helping users build wealth naturally, pennies at a time. From Acorns mighty oaks do grow.

Mission:
With benevolence and courage, we look after the financial best interests of the up-and-coming; beginning with the empowering step of micro-investing.

Values:
1. Lead with heart
2. Make bold decisions
3. Always build trust
4. Never stop growing
5. Advance our society

title: Principal Petroleum Economist
description:
We are looking for a Principal Petroleum Economist to join our Fiscal Team in Houston. Our long history in the upstream sector is underpinned by our deep understanding and modelling of fiscal regimes around the world. We provide unique insight to our research and consulting clients, industry and Governments, on how fiscal terms impact the attractiveness of investment and the valuation of assets.

About you and how you can excel in this role
You are passionate about fiscal systems and their importance across the energy industry. You have an analytical commercial mindset and can formulate leading-edge analysis from a variety of data and information. This is coupled with your ability to communicate highly complex or technical information, delivering messages that are easily understood by junior and senior audiences. You thrive in a collaborative, commercial and client-centric environment. You are also fully proficient in all aspects of modelling complex fiscal regimes.

You have a proven track record of fostering strong working relationships including coaching, influencing and developing others around you. The way in which you work is highly productive and driven, striving to be best in class and supporting others to achieve this. You are focused on continuous improvement and play a key role in implementing better ways of working.

About the role
As part of a world-class team of industry experts, you will have a sophisticated understanding of fiscal terms and their impact on valuations and investment decisions. You will also be a prominent source of insight as demonstrated by your opinions on fiscal change, business environment, petroleum economics, government energy policy and regional geopolitics.

Given your engagement with your network of industry contacts, you will understand their business and priorities. Through proactive external engagement and attendance at meetings, forums and conferences, you will be respected as an influential contributor by colleagues, contacts and clients. Your contributions will be highly influential from the beginning. You will be in demand and expected to lead the way as we value high levels of client contact and pride ourselves in answering their questions.

What youll love about Wood Mackenzie
For the past 45 years, we have established our reputation as a trusted source of knowledge and forward- looking insight for the worlds most innovative organisations.

Our teams are located around the world, and deliver research and consulting projects based on our assessment and valuation of thousands of individual assets, companies and economic indicators such as market supply, demand and price trends. As a result, we can count the worlds key energy institutions and governments among our most loyal clients.

We are committed to supporting our people to grow and thrive. We value different perspectives and aspire to create an inclusive environment that encourages diversity and fosters a sense of belonging. We value everyones contribution and support them to reach their full potential while sustaining an organisational culture of health and well-being. There are opportunities to get involved in our Wellness, Diversity and Inclusion, and Community Engagement initiatives. We actively support flexible working and are happy to consider alternative work patterns, taking into account your needs and the needs of the team or division that you are looking to join.

What youll love about Verisk
Verisk Analytics has an amazing story to tell. In 2017, Forbes magazine named Verisk to its Worlds Most Innovative Companies list for the third consecutive year and to its Americas Best Mid-Size Employers list. We also earned the Great Place to Work Certification for the second consecutive year in recognition of our outstanding workplace culture.

Verisk is a leading data analytics provider serving customers in insurance, natural resources, and financial services. At Verisk, you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create a positive and lasting impact on the business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. As key contributors to our success, our team members enjoy working in a business-casual, collaborative environment that offers state-of-the-art resources, advanced technologies, and an excellent benefits package.

title: Cultural Resources Specialist (Entry level)
description:
Cultural Resources Specialist (Entry level) - (150329)
Description

About Us
At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. Thats why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.

Watch our 'About Us' video

We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward.

Primary Responsibilities
In the role of Cultural Resource Specialist, we'll count on you to:

Support its growing CRM program in Colorado, HDR is seeking an archeologist to join the team. This position is based in Colorado Springs, with an alternate location of Trinidad, Colorado. The ideal candidate will have 1+ years of experience in cultural resource management, including: conducting archaeological surveys, archaeological site monitoring and impact assessments, familiarity with Section 106 of the National Historic Preservation Act (NHPA) and experience with Section 106 compliance. Applicants must be physically capable and possess the skills to perform all aspects of fieldwork. Crew Chiefs are responsible for assisting in the management of large complex archaeological surveys and the sole management of small archaeological surveys, site documentation, make NRHP eligibility recommendations, evaluate site integrity for recorded cultural resources and assess project effects on historic properties; feature and artifact identification and analyses; excavation of shovel test pits; photographs; and mapping. Duties will include:
 Strenuous hiking with a backpack up to 8 miles a day in rugged terrain
 Able to lift 50 pounds
 In field analysis of historic and prehistoric artifacts
 All aspects of archaeological survey, testing, and data recovery
 Complete standard cultural resource forms accurately and concisely
 Digital data collection using Trimble GPS units and tablet-based electronic forms
 Photograph cultural resources

The position is a mix of fieldwork and office work. Accordingly, the position must be able to contribute to and author professional quality reports for NHPA and NEPA compliance, perform laboratory analysis and document the results of analysis. Experience working with Geographic Information Systems (GIS) is also preferred, and to perform other duties as needed

Qualifications

Qualifications

At a minimum, a Bachelors degree (Masters Degree Preferred) in Archaeology, Anthropology, or a related field required.
1+ years related experience including managing field crews in all aspects of fieldwork preferred.
Experience in southeastern Colorado is preferred.
Experience in identifying and recording prehistoric and historic resources preferred.
Experience in specialized analyses directly related to archaeology and cultural resource management (geomorphology, geophysics, macrobotanical and faunal analysis, among others) is preferred, but not required.
Must have good organizational skills, a positive attitude, strong work ethic, and willingness to learn and execute new tasks.
Excellent oral and written communications skills. Applicants will be required to submit both a writing sample and verifiable references.
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite.
Willingness to work under varied weather conditions.
An attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture is a must.


Why HDR
At HDR, we know work isnt only about who you work for; its also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each others contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.

Other Locations: United States-Colorado
Industry: Environment/Sciences
Schedule: Full-time

title: Intern
description:

title: Program Assistant
Analyst
description:
Position Description

The analyst position provides individuals with the opportunity to work collaboratively with experts in economics and public policy, actively participate in project development and management, and develop advanced skills needed to succeed in these fields. In particular, Analysts are responsible for the following tasks:

Designing analytical approaches and performing quantitative analysis collaboratively with economists and project leads to identify emerging trends and risks.
Conducting research and qualitative analysis.
Developing written reports and memos that clearly communicate analytical results for internal and client dissemination, including creating charts, tables, and other visual displays of analytical results.
Assisting project leaders with formulating project work plans, including analytical approach, timeline, and resource allocation.
Assisting project leaders with project management, project administration, and client communications.
Overseeing work performed by research assistants and serving as a resource for junior staff.
A successful individual will be able to work simultaneously and independently in multiple areas of research, quickly learning new topics or methods as needed. As a growing company with an entrepreneurial spirit, Keybridge seeks motivated candidates who are interested in opportunities to demonstrate initiative and develop rapidly expanding responsibilities.

Qualifications & Selection Criteria

The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications:

Bachelors degree in economics, public policy, or a related field.
Minimum two years work experience in economic research or public policy analysis.
Strong interest in economics and the application of economic tools to public policy.
Demonstrated quantitative skills, including a working knowledge of statistics and econometrics.
Demonstrated professional-level writing experience.
Proven capacity to work simultaneously on a variety of issues and advance multiple projects with minimal supervision.
Ability to independently adjust to changing priorities and achieve results within the context of agreed upon objectives and deadlines.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the proven ability to work effectively within project teams.
Exceptional work ethic and good sense of humor.
Current areas of interest to our clients include: macroeconomics and global economic risks, energy policy, environmental policy, regulatory policy, international finance, public health, hazard mitigation, and emergency management.

Compensation & Benefits

Salary based on experience, education, and demonstrated skill sets.
100% employer-paid health, prescription drug, and dental insurance.
100% employer-paid short-term and long-term disability insurance.
Employer-matched retirement savings accounts.
To Apply

Please submit a cover letter, resume, and short writing sample to Ms. Allix Bradecamp at info@keybridgedc.com. Please note that Keybridge does not sponsor employment-based visas.

title: Librarian, Information Resource Manager
description: Desired: Legal ResearchThe PCAOB is hiring a Librarian or Information Resource Manager in the Office of Economic Risk and Analysis (ERA).
